channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How clashes at rock musician James’ concert in Bangladesh unfolded
This Week in Explainers: Why a free trade agreement with New Zealand is good news for India
History Today: When Benazir Bhutto was assassinated in Pakistan
What’s the 1MDB scam in which ex-Malaysian PM Najib Razak has been found guilty?
Tariff wars, retaliations: Retracing Trump’s trade actions in 2025
‘Papa, I can’t bear the pain’: How Indian-origin man, kept waiting for hours at Canada hospital, died
Why India and Bangladesh must look for a strategic reset
item.description: While the 'Sonaali Adhyaay' of the past decade has faded, the future of the two neighbours will be defined by their ability to transition from a regime-centric alliance to a resilient, state-to-state partnership rooted in economic necessity and regional stability

item.title: India and China look to improve ties, but Delhi’s cautious approach must continue in 2026
item.description: India has adapted to a strategic environment in which stability is maintained through preparedness and balance rather than trust

item.title: Sheikh Hasina’s death sentence: An ‘imperfect trial’ is dangerous rhetoric, not justice
item.description: ‘Mass atrocity’ is not a socially elastic phrase to be invoked when convenient; in a trial context, it is a legal classification that the state must prove beyond a reasonable doubt

item.title: How Chile confirms the global phenomenon of the rise of right in 2025
item.description: The Chilean presidential election aligns with a broader right-wing shift across the region — most recently seen in Bolivia — reversing the 'pink tide' of left-leaning governments over the past two decades

item.title: Silent guardians beneath the sea: How India’s K-4 missile completed the nuclear triad
item.description: The nuclear triad, once a distant ambition, is now a reality—making India safer, stronger, and more secure on the world stage

item.title: Why Dhaka’s rhetoric softened after the Army Chiefs spoke
item.description: For India, the conversation reinforces a time-tested approach: engage institutions, ignore theatrics, trust professionalism. For Bangladesh, it was an opportunity to let its strongest assets, its disciplined military leadership and capable diplomatic cadre, speak through action rather than amplification
